title: Carrie Ann Inaba laughs off her televised chair tumble on 'Dancing With the Stars'
text:
CLOSE ABC's "Dancing with the Stars" included a dramatic exit, "Saturday Night Fever," and a surprising finish. USA TODAY

We've seen dancers wipe out on "Dancing With the Stars." But Carrie Ann Inaba's tumble from the judge's table Monday was the first time this season a judge has tumbled from the desk.

The ever-graceful Inaba, a co-host on CBS' "The Talk" and an original Fly Girl from the '90s sketch show "In Living Color," laughed off the bizarre incident. It started when host Tom Bergeron pointed out a misplaced broom prop from contestant Kate Flannery's "Mary Poppins" routine on the floor in front of Inaba's desk.

The broom's movement startled Inaba, who tried to sit back down on her wheeled desk chair that had other ideas.

Inaba followed the moving chair with a slow-motion fall onto the floor in her resplendent green Disney Night gown. One thing about Inaba, she never stopped smiling even as her chair shot out to the first row of the audience.

Carrie Ann Inaba took her Disney seriously on "Dancing With the Stars" Disney night. (Photo: Eric McCandless, ABC)

Recap: Disney Night brings princess tears, Hannah Brown as Jasmine

"It was a slip!" Inaba said laughing afterward.

"I knew those chairs were gonna be trouble," Bergeron said, adding that they might need last week's visiting judge Leah Remini to return to fill in.

"I hope Carrie Ann has good insurance," Flannery said later.

This is not Inaba's first judge tumble, as this memorable event from season 8 proves. To be fair, she does stand up a lot and gets very passionate in her judge opinions.

More: With fresh support from Trump, Sean Spicer on his 'Dancing With the Stars' survival

description: Judge Carrie Ann Inaba managed a chair wipe-out on "Dancing With the Stars" Monday and she's a judge. She laughed it off.
